review: If you have Apple mobile devices (iphone/ipads), I cannot recommend this more highly. It is so easy to mirror the screen of your mobile device and send music, pictures, or video from your phone to the TV. The built in apps work really well also.I have a "smart" TV, but the apps (like Netflix and Hulu+) on the Apple TV are much more responsive and work much better than these same apps on my TV. Also, my TV is a good distance from my router. My TV could never get a strong enough wifi signal to stream video reliably, but the Apple TV does not have this problem.Over, I highly recommend this product!

review: The airplay mirroring is horrible with quality varying widely depending on mirror device.  My macbook pro retina (2013, Mavericks OS) mirrors with 1 to 2 second lag making it impossible to use as a mirrored or extended display.  It seriously will give you headaches to operate a cursor with this much lag.  Videos playing from websites lag horribly with terrible refreshing of HD content.  The audio quality is also degraded.  This issue is even further exacerbated using a macbook air (2013, Mavericks OS) and impossible for use.  It's even worse than remote access many encounter with IT departments.  Yeah, crazy.It's appalling that apple would market this feature.  It's the only reason I purchased it.  Now I have a 100$ glorified Netflix, HBO GO box.  YEAY!  It's like Netflix heaven at my place.  You can watch it on my PS3, PS4, my HTPC, and now this wonderful 100$ paperweight.Now about apple customer support.  Just terrible.  When I first brought up this issue they sent me to a troubleshooting page of iOS devices.  That's right ladies and gentlemen, they sent me to a troubleshooting page for iOS devices even though the problem was associated with a macbook pro and a macbook air. FFFUUUUU.......Then they blamed the router.  But wait for it. I had the best router possible from their recommendation.  What the fu....So then we hooked up the AppleTV AND Macbooks through ethernet directly to the router and still got terrible lag.  With a direct connection?? What?  This is Apple quality?  The same people that made the MacBook Retina made this garbage. Really?So then we tried another TV and two other monitors.  Yeah that was waste of my time.  All in all I lost around 4 hours and 100$ because Apple can't get their you know together.In conclusion this 100$ box of failure is worse than a 5$ HDMI cable.If you think I'm raging...well you're right.  That's all this box is good for, a good rage.  But in my defense this issue is all over their support forums with absolutely no solutions offered.  So I'm not the only one experiencing this issue.
